node.text: Well, well, look what the murky waters dragged in. Come closer, dearie, don't be shy! You've found 'the real Silvermirror Witch', alright... hah! It's just something the village fools have taken to calling me. So then, what can this old lady do for you?

option.optiontext: You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
Any secret brews you can offer?
Who are you?
I need something to treat a mosquito bite.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Gasp*</color>! Someone's been snooping around the Garden of the Witches, haven't you dearie? I do know the brambles' trick, but dare I entrust it the knowledge to you? Dark secrets lie buried in that place. How about you help me with something first?

option.optiontext: Fine, what do you need?
I'll consider it.

node.text: The plants I require are Silvermirror Irises <color=teal>(20)</color>, Darkmire Damp Roots <color=teal>(10)</color>, Gravelstem Whiteflowers <color=teal>(10)</color> and Marshland Feather Reeds <color=teal>(10)</color>. I assure you, they all grow around Silvermirror Fen somewhere.

option.optiontext: Anything more specific you could describe about the plants at least?
Very well, I'll get you your herbs.
Not my kind of job, I'm afraid.

node.text: I could talk about plants all day, flower. Which one shall we start with?

option.optiontext: Silvermirror Iris?
Darkmire Damp Root?
Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
Marshland Feather Reed?
I guess I've heard enough.
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: Ah yes, the 'rose of the witches', flower... It grows in abundance all around the swamp, which is good. It contains magical properties useful for most potions, thus much of it is also required.

option.optiontext: Darkmire Damp Root?
Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
Marshland Feather Reed?
I guess I've heard enough.
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: Oh yes, one that draws power from decay. Look for it near waterlogged places, oftentimes near shade too. It's there that the root grows thickest.

option.optiontext: Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
Marshland Feather Reed?
Silvermirror Iris?
I guess I've heard enough.
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: The Gravelstem, a small flower, but so hardy its roots bite their way into stone itself! The minerals they extract from stone power the very plant itself. You need only to keep your eye out for rocky places, and the white flowers are likely to catch your eye.

option.optiontext: Marshland Feather Reed?
Silvermirror Iris?
Darkmire Damp Root?
I guess I've heard enough.
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: Mmm... the Feather Reed likes to sway in the wind. There's not much of that in the swamp, so it often chooses to grow on the banks of open water. There are a few such places here, dearie, if you keep your eyes peeled.

option.optiontext: Silvermirror Iris?
Darkmire Damp Root?
Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
I guess I've heard enough.
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: So how about it, dearie - got a green thumb on you? Remember, the plants I require are Silvermirror Irises <color=teal>(20)</color>, Darkmire Damp Roots <color=teal>(10)</color>, Gravelstem Whiteflowers <color=teal>(10)</color> and Marshland Feather Reeds <color=teal>(10)</color>.

option.optiontext: Hold on, anything more specific you could describe about the plants at least?
Very well, I'll get you your herbs.
This isn't my kind of job, I'm afraid.

node.text: You do that, flower, and I promise the potions I've got for you won't let you down. Keep yourself alive out there!

Who am I? Oooh, the whisper in the shadows, perhaps? The keeper of forbidden knowledge, the master of the occult! Hahaha! No, oh no, dearie! In truth, I'm just someone with a deep appreciation for rare, exotic herbs and curious little potions. 'Tis why I live here in this swamp of all places, because of the plants that grow here.

option.optiontext: You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
Any secret brews you can offer?
I see, now I must leave.

node.text: You see, it's becoming difficult for 'The Real Witch' to craft her brews, as she's running low on special herbs. Alas, I'm not as nimble as I once was and every year I swear the swamp only grows more dangerous. I hope you're familiar with the handling of alchemical plants, dearie?
There's a bottle on the table, use that!
Ah, there you are, flower! I was beginning to wonder if I'd see you again. Have the marshlands treated you kindly, or did they show you their ugly, brutal side?

option.optiontext: Are these the plants you're looking for? <color=#9C8C77>*offer quest items*</color>
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
Tell me, who are you really?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?

node.text: As you say, dearie. Well anyway, if you come across them, I'd very much appreciate you bring me the Silvermirror Irises <color=teal>(20)</color>, Darkmire Damp Roots <color=teal>(10)</color>, Gravelstem Whiteflowers <color=teal>(10)</color> and Marshland Feather Reeds <color=teal>(10)</color>.

option.optiontext: Hold on, describe these plants in detail again...
Tell me, who are you really?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?

node.text: Oooh, and such lovely specimens you found too! Thank you, dearie. How about I show you what they can be turned into? It only takes a bit of skill for these brews, really...\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You observe carefully as the 'witch' extracts oils from the swamp plants into protective ampoules.*</color>

option.optiontext: What are the fancy potions good for?
I wanted to know about certain brambles in the swamp, what they thirst for...

node.text: Well, dearie, my ampoules only have the potential to render you near invulnerable against mortal blows, though their effects dissipate quickly. But while it lasts, gods themselves couldn't strike you down! Well, figuratively speaking - don't test that theory. If you do find yourself up against a particularly gnarly monster, though, keep one of my ampoules at hand.

option.optiontext: I wanted to know about certain brambles in the swamp, what they thirst for...

node.text: Yes, brambles that whisper and groan in their thirst... You should take care with such things, normally plants aren't meant to speak, you know? The only ones thirsty around here would be those created by the Witches of the Silvermirror Fen. Anything they ever touched is just bad news.

Their brambles have no thirst for water, oh no dearie. It's blood they crave, and unless you intend to feed yourself to them, you'll want to carry a vial of blood concentrate to pour onto them. Seeing as you helped me, I'll make it for you. Just bring me 3 blood sacs from the giant bloodsuckers that are a pestilence on this swamp.

Who am I? Oooh, the whisper in the shadows, perhaps? The keeper of forbidden knowledge, the master of the occult! Hahaha! No, oh no, dearie! In truth, I'm just someone with a deep appreciation for rare, exotic herbs and curious little potions. 'Tis why I live here in this swamp of all places, because of the plants that grow here.

option.optiontext: Are these the plants you're looking for? <color=#9C8C77>*offer quest items*</color>
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Gasp*</color>! Someone's been snooping around the Garden of the Witches, haven't you dearie? I do know the brambles' trick, but dare I entrust it the knowledge to you? Dark secrets lie buried in that place. How about you help me restock with rare swamp herbs and I'll consider helping you in return.

option.optiontext: Are these the plants you're looking for? <color=#9C8C77>*offer quest items*</color>
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
Remind me, which plants were you running short on?
Tell me, who are you really?

node.text: The plants I require are Silvermirror Irises <color=teal>(20)</color>, Darkmire Damp Roots <color=teal>(10)</color>, Gravelstem Whiteflowers <color=teal>(10)</color> and Marshland Feather Reeds <color=teal>(10)</color>. I assure you, they all grow around these marshlands somewhere.

option.optiontext: Anything more specific you could describe about them, like where they normally grow?
Tell me, who are you really?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?

node.text: Here, have a few of the potions I made too. Afraid I can't spare the whole patch, think I'll have to start relying on these to gather more herbs, But you'll know how to make your own now, won't you, dearie?

option.optiontext: Right, thanks.

node.text: Yes, flower? Come seeking the mighty brews of this old 'Witch'? I'm afrain I only maintain a small stock, some of these herbs I require are painfully rare after all.

option.optiontext: You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
Remind me, what do I need for those thirsty swamp brambles?
I brought bloodsucker sacs for the concentrate.
Could use a vial of your good stuff.
Remind me, who are you really?
Wanted to ask more about the swamp plants.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Gasp*</color>! Someone's been snooping around the Garden of the Witches, haven't you dearie? I do know the brambles' trick, but dare I entrust it the knowledge to you? Dark secrets lie buried in that place.

Well, I guess you did help me before, didn't you dearie? But you should take care with brambles that whisper and groan in their thirst, normally plants aren't meant to speak, you know? And it's no thirst for water those ones complain about.

It's blood they crave, and unless you intend to feed yourself to them, you'll want to carry a vial of blood concentrate to pour onto them. Not to worry, I'll make it for you, dearie. But I'll need 3 blood sacs from those giant bloodsuckers that are a pestilence on this swamp.

option.optiontext: Could use a vial of your good stuff in the meantime.
Remind me, who are you really?
I see...

node.text: Those brambles have no thirst for water, oh no dearie. It's blood they crave, and unless you intend to feed yourself to them, you'll want to carry a vial of blood concentrate to pour onto them. Not to worry, I'll make it for you, dearie. But I'll need 3 blood sacs from those giant bloodsuckers that are a pestilence on this swamp.

option.optiontext: Could use a vial of your good stuff in the meantime.
Remind me, who are you really?
I see...

node.text: Right then, dearie, these will do nicely. Now, I believe I lectured you enough about the Silvermirror Witches before, didn't I? Village sarcasm about me aside, those hags were, and always will be the real witches in these swamps - and I mean that in the worst possible way. I hope whatever of theirs you're looking for is worth it.
Anyhow, here's your blood concentrate. Take care of yourself now, flower, and... are you sure you don't want to buy a healing potion off me... just in case?

option.optiontext: Sure, if it eases your conscience.
Thanks for the concern, but I'll be alright.

node.text: Who am I? Oooh, the whisper in the shadows, perhaps? The keeper of forbidden knowledge, the master of the occult! Hahaha! No, oh no, dearie! In truth, I'm just someone with a deep appreciation for rare, exotic herbs and curious little potions. 'Tis why I live here in this swamp of all places, because of the plants that grow here.

option.optiontext: You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
Remind me, what do I need for those thirsty swamp brambles?
I brought bloodsucker sacs for the concentrate.
Could use a vial of your good stuff.
Fair enough.

node.text: As you say, dearie. Is there anything else I can help you with?

option.optiontext: You wouldn't happen to know what certain swamp brambles thirst for?
Remind me, what do I need for those thirsty swamp brambles?
I brought bloodsucker sacs for the concentrate.
Could use a vial of your good stuff.
Remind me, who are you really?
Wanted to ask more about the swamp plants.

Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
Marshland Feather Reed?

option.optiontext: Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
Marshland Feather Reed?
Silvermirror Iris?
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: The Gravelstem, a small flower, but so hardy its roots bite their way into stone itself! The minerals they extract from stone power the very plant itself. You need only to keep your eye out for rocky places, and the white flowers are likely to catch your eye.

option.optiontext: Marshland Feather Reed?
Silvermirror Iris?
Darkmire Damp Root?
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: Mmm... the Feather Reed likes to sway in the wind. There's not much of that in the swamp, so it often chooses to grow on the banks of open water. There are a few such places here, dearie, if you keep your eyes peeled.

option.optiontext: Silvermirror Iris?
Darkmire Damp Root?
Gravelstem Whiteflowers?
I guess I've heard enough.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*As you approach the brambles, they rustle and shift in an uneasy manner. Blocked behind them, you see a barrow entrance disappear into the darkness beneath the ground.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Suddenly, reacting to your presence, the rustling of the brambles begins to resemble more of a whisper!*</color>\n\nThirsty... thirsty... thirsty...!

option.optiontext: Um... hello?
What do you mean 'thirsty'? This swamp isn't exactly dry.
<color=#9C8C77>*Step away, keep your distance.*</color>

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*The brambles ignore your words, merely continuing their chant.*</color>\n\nThirsty... thirsty... thirsty...!

option.optiontext: What do you mean 'thirsty'? This swamp isn't exactly dry.
<color=#9C8C77>*Step away, keep your distance.*</color>

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*The brambles' whispers turn agitated.*</color>\n\nNot water... not water... not water!

<color=#9C8C77>*You get the feeling these brambles aren't of the mind to simply allow you to pass into the barrow. Perhaps if you could satiate their thirst somehow? But first you'd have to know what they thirst for. You think it may be best to look for advice from an alchemist within the smuggler village of the swamp.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Just as before, the rustling of the brambles turns into a familiar chant.*</color>\n\nThirsty... thirsty... thirsty... thirsty... thirsty...!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Pour a vial of concentrated blood onto the roots.*</color>

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*The dark brambles quiver in excitement!*</color>
